intro: Desmoscelis villosa var. stachyoides, commonly known as the hairy desmoscelis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and showy, pale pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are ovate to elliptical in shape, often with a velvety texture. The flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences and bloom during the warmer months of the year.
